mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Fighting AI integration and dismissing competitors' AI features
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Losing 8 out of 10 deals to AI-enabled competitors
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Embrace AI even if imperfect, focus on efficiency messaging
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Smart SaaS founders saying 'AI is stupid' and 'competitors have dumb hallucinations'

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Panicking during market downturns and making hasty decisions
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Selling company too cheap or making poor strategic moves
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Keep building and focus on long-term competitive position
mistakes_to_avoid.example: LinkedIn panicking in 2016 and selling to Microsoft cheaply at $25-26 billion

actionable_quotes.quote: Just build. You cannot control everything you cannot control public multiples you cannot control a lot of stuff in the short term but you can control whether you're more competitive or less competitive
actionable_quotes.context: Advice for SaaS companies during market uncertainty
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on controllable factors like product development and competitive positioning

actionable_quotes.quote: You're going to lose that deal eight times out of 10 when your competitor that looks a lot like you goes in and gets everyone excited about efficiency for AI
actionable_quotes.actionability: Immediately start integrating AI features to remain competitive

actionable_quotes.quote: You can't cut your way to growth cutting does not produce growth
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on growth initiatives rather than just cost cutting
